Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Vase of fine paste
Description: This vase, made of fine paste in a milky colour which was obtained by the engobe is very characteristic of meroitic ceramics. It takes the form of a gourd of which the neck is painted in black with a row of incisions. The belly is decorated by three black points. The object comes from the excavations of J. Garstang at Meroe in 1909-1910.
